question.text: For the reaction, $2 \mathrm{CO}+\mathrm{O}_2 \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{CO}_2 ; \Delta H=-560 \mathrm{~kJ}$. Two moles of $\mathrm{CO}$ and one mole of $\mathrm{O}_2$ are taken in a container of volume $1 \mathrm{~L}$. They completely form two moles of $\mathrm{CO}_2$, the gases deviate appreciably from ideal behaviour. If the pressure in the vessel changes from 70 to $40 \mathrm{~atm}$, find the magnitude (absolute value) of $\Delta U$ at $500 \mathrm{~K} .(1 \mathrm{~L}-\mathrm{atm}=0.1 \mathrm{~kJ})$
